senses.definition: ' within reason'  Within reason means 'within the limits of what you could expect'.
example: What is the reason for his strange behaviour? [j33] You should give reasons for your choice. [j33] The main reason I've come into town is to visit the dentist
I reasoned that the meeting would be cancelled because of the bus strike
Phil's impossible.  He just won't listen to reason
It stands to reason you'll be late for work if you don't get up on time
I'll do anything within reason to get a job there
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'adjective See reasonable'.[j35] 'adjective reasoned' That was a very reasoned argument you presented to the committee.[j35]'noun reasoning' The reasoning for his decision was unclear.

senses.definition: ' rough it'  If you say that you are roughing it, you mean that you are living without the comforts that you normally have, such as hot water and electricity.
example: Julio's lost his job and his wife is very sick.  They're really having a rough time
' If the sea is rough, there are many large waves due to strong winds or a storm
' If you say that someone has rough manners or ways, you mean that they do not have the more gentle, polite or refined habits that society usually expects
The boys are camping overnight in the mountains. They haven't got any tents so they're really roughing it
note: ... THE OPPOSITE of this is smooth.   2 ' 'adjective If you say that someone is rough, you mean that they use force or physical pressure in order to get things done.  The police were excep~ tionally rough in the way they handled the protesters. 3 ' 'adjective If something such as a calculation is rough, it is only approximate.  It is not exact or precise.  The room's about 12 metres by 12 metres at a rough estimate.  Bill drew a rough map of the area for the tourist.
... WORD FAMILY 'adverb roughly' Bill treats his dog roughly.  It's roughly 3 o'clock.
